title: Drawing, "Design for a Humidor and Pipe Holder", 1935
medium: Pen and black ink, yellow and white pastel (recto and verso), graphite on cream tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in pen and black ink at lower right:  POT  À TABAC-SUPPORT-PIPES/BAGUES SUPPORT PIPES IVOIRE/BOUTON PRISE COUVERCLE-d°-; to right:  J.P./35; to right of rim:  HAUTEUR/COUVERCLE; at lower right of humidor: (square root sign) ø; in graphite to right of body:  Cette partie doit-elle être de bois??
provenance: Formerly Puiforcat Orfèvre archive; Jim Finguerra; John Finguerra
creditline: Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra
description: Circular body with hanging reeded rim indicated in yellow pastel drawn in plan and elevation.  Rim is fitted with 8 circular pipe holders indicated in white pastel to be executed in ivory centering a circular lid with finial indicated in white pastel to be executed in ivory.  Underdrawing in graphite of humidor in golden section.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Humidor and Pipe Holder", 1935.
1935. Pen and black ink, yellow and white pastel (recto and verso), graphite on cream tracing paper. Gift of John Finguerra in memory of his brother Jim Finguerra. 1995-164-3.
